adjectives.description: untameable (comparative more untameable, superlative most untameable)

entries.meaning: Incapable of being controlled, subdued, or tamed.
examples: “My lord,” said Mary, “it seems to me that you fling on my unhappy and devoted head those evils, which, with far more justice, I may impute to your own turbulent, wild, and untameable dispositions.”
